the zone loaded I got kicked to windows. Now whenever i go in and try to
play it does the same as soon as it loads.

Help!!


Bontempi Biryani

  

Phil

Thursday, October 05, 2000 - 05:40 pm
Delete the zone files for WC and let it get fixed through the patch server.
That *should* clear up the problem.

  

Anthony

Thursday, October 05, 2000 - 05:40 pm
Never been to that zone, but I think it's in Kunark. If it is and you
haven't bought Kunark, well, there's your problem right there. I suggest
creating a new character on the server and petitioning.

If you did by the expansion, my first guess would be for you to try the
"Thorough File Check" button in the patch program whern you start EQ. You
might also try deleting the dreadlands files and allowing the Kunark Patch
to redownload them.

  

Jonathan Nieto

Monday, October 16, 2000 - 09:44 am
Hey guys,

I have a problem getting EQ started. I've installed the game and downloaded all the patches. I have a 3d Accelerator card (Voodoo3) but when i click "Play Online" i get this weird error message with no error info in it. Just the "Ok" button. Can anyone help? I'm itching to play the game. Thanks guys...

  

Acider

Monday, October 16, 2000 - 04:43 pm
Hmm,

Haven't seen that one before. What are the specs of your system (mother board, CPU, etc). Also, are you running low on disk space?

Couple of quick questions:

1). Under the options section, what interface are you using (should have an option to use "Primary Display Driver" or "3DFX Glide").

2). Did you upgrade to the Voodoo 3 or was that the original card? Also, are the 3DFX tools installed?

3). Do other 3D games work (Unreal, etc)?

4). What version of directX are you running?

  

Xenomorph

Tuesday, October 17, 2000 - 05:51 pm
its a glide error..

did you use to have a Voodoo 1 or Voodoo 2 in your system?

start Windows in VGA mode. remove all video drivers, remove all glide
drivers. then re-install your V3 drivers.

  

Just Me

Tuesday, October 17, 2000 - 05:52 pm
just erase all the files that have word 'glide' within their name (or copy
them to the location that not in your system path if you afraid to delete
them)

then reinstall Voodoo 3 drivers.

  

Dan Harmon

Tuesday, October 17, 2000 - 05:52 pm
The voodoo3 drivers you downloaded had complete instructions on how to
uninstall your old drivers. This isn't recommended, it's required.

eqplayer

Friday, December 29, 2000 - 10:00 pm
Hmm. What are you using to connect to the internet? If you you behind a firewall that could be an issue. Notice the error message says patch.everquest.com:7000TCP. The 7000 refers to the port number EQ is trying to use. If you are behind a firewall or using a proxy, this port may not be available.

Post a message with some more info on your connection and I might be able to help out. Let me know, what ISP, how are you connected, what security software do you have installed (Norton Firewall, Black Ice, etc.) if any and if you are sharing your internet connection with more then one computer. If you are, how?

  

Jay Thao

Sunday, March 11, 2001 - 07:48 pm
Okay heres my little problem. I recently installed EQ and got the patch downhloaded as well. After getting on a server, I am only able to play for about 3 minutes and then everything freezes. I can't even alt+tab to escape. I am able to run diablo 2 fine and I have directX 7.0 on. I am using nvidia gf 2 MX video card. Everytthing runs fine for only about 3 minutes then locks/freezes. Attempting to try using directX 8 but if anyone has any clue what is going on and what can resolve my issue, would greatly appreciate it. Thanks!!

  

eqplayer

Monday, March 12, 2001 - 09:01 am
Jay - this is an odd one. I also use a Nvidia card (Gforce2) and have not had any difficulties. I am using the Detonator 3 drivers from nvidia's site (www.nvidia.com) and DirectX 7.0a. To get things working, I followed these steps:

1). Revert to the standard VGA driver.
2). Install Direct X 7.0a.
3). Installed Nvidia drivers.

One other thought, my older system I had been playing with was running a Banshee based card. It would do the same thing. I could play Diablo and other games, but EQ would freeze after a short period of play. I tried updating drivers and did all the troubleshooting steps. It turned out that the card itself had a problem. In that example, the card could handle the less graphically intensive Diablo - but would fail to run the more detailed - 3D rich EQ game.

Hope this helps.
